content: Seems like Kim's son may not be a frontrunner anymore to succeed him. Mind you I bet this will change a few times before and after Kim's death. quote: SEOUL (Reuters) - North Korean leader Kim Jong-il put to rest this week any doubt about whom he sees as his second in command when he elevated his brother-in-law Jang Song-taek to a powerful military post, analysts said on Friday. Kim, 67, was re-elected to his leadership post at parliament on Thursday but questions about his health, raised by a suspected stroke in August, remained. He cut a gaunt figure at the session and, his hair thinned and graying, walked with a limp onto stage. ++http://ca.news.yahoo.com/s/reuters/090410/world/international_us_korea_north_jang
quote: SEOUL (Reuters) - North Korean leader Kim Jong-il put to rest this week any doubt about whom he sees as his second in command when he elevated his brother-in-law Jang Song-taek to a powerful military post, analysts said on Friday. Kim, 67, was re-elected to his leadership post at parliament on Thursday but questions about his health, raised by a suspected stroke in August, remained. He cut a gaunt figure at the session and, his hair thinned and graying, walked with a limp onto stage.
reply: Seems like Kim's son may not be a frontrunner anymore to succeed him. Mind you I bet this will change a few times before and after Kim's death.  ++http://ca.news.yahoo.com/s/reuters/090410/world/international_us_korea_north_jang

He cut a gaunt figure at the session and, his hair thinned and graying, walked with a limp onto stage. ++http://ca.news.yahoo.com/s/reuters/090410/world/international_us_korea_north_jang Actually, it was a bottle of Glen Fiddich which addressed the "assembly." I've had a hard time telling them apart for years. Enough Glen Fiddich, and even the dead can walk - So either way, they haven't made their case, err, argument... Dave

content: Who doubted he was still alive? I didn't. We'll know when he's dead because all of the people in that country will be forced to mourn for two straight weeks for the loss of their; "Dear Leader." Definitely not looking forward to that crap clogging up the mainstream news for two straight weeks. This message has been edited. Last edited by: mrmixitup, Fri 10 April 2009 12:07 PM
